{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |Year=2009â10 |Prev year=2008â09 |Next year=2010â11 |Team=Maryland Terrapins |Image=Maryland Terps logo.png |Conference=Atlantic Coast Conference |Division= |ShortConference=ACC |CoachRank=18 |APRank=20 |Record=24–9 |ConfRecord=13–3 |HeadCoach=[[Gary Williams]] |AsstCoach1=[[Keith Booth]]
[[Chuck Driesell]]
Robert Ehsan
Troy Wainwright |StadiumArena=[[Comcast Center (arena)|Comcast Center]] |Champion= ACC Regular Season Co-Champions |BowlTourney=[[2010 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Tournament]] |BowlTourneyResult=Second Round }} {{2009â10 ACC men's basketball standings}} The '''2009â10 Maryland Terrapins men's basketball team''' represented the [[University of Maryland, College Park|University of Maryland]] in the 2009â10 [[college basketball]] season as a member of the [[Atlantic Coast Conference]] (ACC). [[Gary Williams]] was in his 21st year as the team's head coach. The Terrapins finished the season 24–9, 13–3 in ACC play, to claim a share of the regular-season championship with [[2009â10 Duke Blue Devils men's basketball team|Duke]]. They lost in the quarterfinals of the [[2010 ACC Men's Basketball Tournament]] to [[2009â10 Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets men's basketball team|Georgia Tech]]. They received an at-large bid to the [[2010 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament]], earning a 4 seed in the Midwest Region. They defeated 13-seed [[2009â10 Houston Cougars men's basketball team|Houston]] in the first round before losing to 5-seed and AP #13 [[2009â10 Michigan State Spartans men's basketball team|Michigan State]] in the second round. In a rare double-sweep of regular-season awards, Williams was voted as the [[Atlantic Coast Conference Men's Basketball Coach of the Year|ACC Coach of the Year]] while [[Greivis Vasquez]] was named the [[Atlantic Coast Conference Men's Basketball Player of the Year|ACC Player of the Year]]. ==Preseason== === Recruiting === {{College Athlete Recruit Start|40=no|collapse=no|year=2009}} {{College
